c74object.name: 264.lockstatus
c74object.digest: Check whether or not a patch is currently locked.
c74object.description: Returns the current status of a patch (locked/unlocked) and in a bpatcher displays the status graphically.

inlet.description: Triggers output of current lock status.

method.name: bang
method.description: Triggers output of current lock status.

method.name: active
method.description: Sets whether or not 264.lockstatus outputs at regular intervals (active 1 or other non-zero integer argument) or only upon receiving a bang (active 0).

attribute.name: active
attribute.description: Sets whether or not 264.lockstatus outputs at regular intervals (active 1 or other non-zero integer argument) or only upon receiving a bang (active 0).

c74object.discussion: 264.lockstatus allows you to check whether or not a patch is currently locked. This can be useful, for example, when building keyboard control systems and you need to disable your keyboard shortcuts while editing your patch, i.e. when your patch is unlocked. A bang will trigger output of the current status, or the active attribute can be turned on for continuous polling. Used in a bpatcher, 264.lockstatus also provides a graphical representation of the patchâ€™s lock status.
